intro: Deinandra increscens, commonly known as the increasing sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, seed-filled cones. Deinandra increscens is often found in coastal and inland regions where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
